dcterms:creator: S. Afriat
dcterms:description: A dataset that can be thought of as being generated by a consumer maximizing a continuous and increasing utility function if and only if it is free of revealed preference cycles containing a strict relation.
dcterms:title: Purchase Dataset

dcterms:creator: Y. Kitamura
J. Stoye
dcterms:description: A dataset that characterizes random utility maximization when observing the distribution of demand over a finite number of linear budget sets.
dcterms:title: Random Utility Model (RUM)

dcterms:creator: S. Afriat
dcterms:description: A dataset that is used to test the generalized axiom of revealed preference, ensuring that there are no cycles in the revealed preference relation.
dcterms:title: GARP (Generalized Axiom of Revealed Preference)

dcterms:creator: R. L. Matzkin
M. K. Richter
dcterms:description: A dataset that characterizes well-behaved utility maximization with single-valued demand, ensuring that there are no cycles in the revealed preference relation.
dcterms:title: SARP (Strong Axiom of Revealed Preference)

dcterms:creator: R. Deb
D. Mishra
dcterms:description: A dataset that explores the implementation of contingent contracts in economic models.
dcterms:title: Contingent Contract Dataset

dcterms:creator: R. Deb
Y. Kitamura
J. K. H. Quah
J. Stoye
dcterms:description: A dataset that provides a theoretical and empirical analysis of revealed price preferences.
dcterms:title: Expenditure-Augmented Utility Function
